Central Illinois Rural School Collaborative
July 2 at 1:24 PM ¬∑

Go Shiloh....

Shiloh Elementary continues to build on our Farm to Table project. Third and Second Grades took the lead with Mrs. Kristina Milburn (3rd) and Mrs. Sandy Moses (2nd) organizing activities.This past year every month was built around a local food with one day having all learning activities based on that food theme. This spring with COVID-19 and school closing to students in March the normal greenhouse projects were canceled. The Elementary stepped forward to expand their farm to school activities. Administration and School Board have been supportive. The teachers with a group of volunteers have cleaned up with greenhouse. updated equipment, and transitioned to more vegetables. They hope is to get students involved when in-school attendance resumes this fall. They have plans to begin a Farmer's Market and invite community members. The greenhouse is being built into future science lesson plans. As their place based learning opportunities continue to grow there next phase will be adding raised bed gardens beside the bus barns and near the prairie plot.

post_text: The summer crew invited Richard (Woody) Wood to visit and celebrate his 80th Birthday! Woody retired from the former Illinois Cereal Mill March 2003 and started working for Shiloh in April. He helped with summer cleaning, sub-janitor, drove students, and took care of almost every evening/weekend event for 17 years. This summer he is retiring from Shiloh, but will still be on the Hume Fire Dept. Heck, he started cleaning the old Hume Grade School when he was 7 years old. His Dad was custodian there and after morning paper route, Woody went to school to clean boards, and help get the fire going to heat the school. Everyone will miss his smile and kind words at the ballgames, but we all know he will be still be busy working at home!
